segment.source: File Type Association Results Pane Columns
segment.target: File Type Association Results Pane Columns

segment.source: File Type Association Results Pane Columns
segment.target: File Type Association Results Pane Columns

segment.source: File Type Association Results Pane Columns
segment.target: File Type Association Results Pane Columns

segment.source: In the Application Virtualization Client Management Console, the Results pane of the File Associations node can display a variety of columns.
segment.target: In the Application Virtualization Client Management Console, the Results pane of the File Associations node can display a variety of columns.

segment.source: Extension, Description, and Application are shown by default.
segment.target: Extension, Description, and Application are shown by default.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You can add or remove a column simply by right-clicking in the Results pane, selecting View, then selecting Add/Remove Columns.
segment.target: You can add or remove a column simply by right-clicking in the Results pane, selecting View, then selecting Add/Remove Columns.

segment.source: The list can be sorted by any of the columns.
segment.target: The list can be sorted by any of the columns.

segment.source: Columns that contain dates and times are sorted in chronological order, not alphabetical.
segment.target: Columns that contain dates and times are sorted in chronological order, not alphabetical.

segment.source: For columns that contain a mix of dates and times and text, dates and times are considered to come before any other text.
segment.target: For columns that contain a mix of dates and times and text, dates and times are considered to come before any other text.

segment.source: The available column names contain the following elements.
segment.target: The available column names contain the following elements.

segment.source: Extension
segment.target: Extension

segment.source: The extension, such as DOC or HTML.
segment.target: The extension, such as DOC or HTML.

segment.source: This is the field by which the list is organized, so each extension is displayed once on the list.
segment.target: This is the field by which the list is organized, so each extension is displayed once on the list.

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: The description or user-friendly name.
segment.target: The description or user-friendly name.

segment.source: Application
segment.target: Application

segment.source: The name and version of the application associated with the default action of this file type.
segment.target: The name and version of the application associated with the default action of this file type.

segment.source: Parameters
segment.target: Parameters

segment.source: The parameters for the default action.
segment.target: The parameters for the default action.

segment.source: Default Action
segment.target: Default Action

segment.source: The name of the default action.
segment.target: The name of the default action.

segment.source: DDE
segment.target: DDE

segment.source: Displays Enabled or Disabled depending on whether Dynamic Data Exchange (DDE) is enabled for the default action.
segment.target: Displays Enabled or Disabled depending on whether Dynamic Data Exchange (DDE) is enabled for the default action.

segment.source: Linked Extensions
segment.target: Linked Extensions

segment.source: A comma-separated list of other extensions that are associated with the same type.
segment.target: A comma-separated list of other extensions that are associated with the same type.

segment.source: Confirm Open
segment.target: Confirm Open

segment.source: Displays Yes or No depending on whether Confirm open after download is selected.
segment.target: Displays Yes or No depending on whether Confirm open after download is selected.

segment.source: Always Show
segment.target: Always Show

segment.source: Displays Yes or No depending on whether Always show extension is selected.
segment.target: Displays Yes or No depending on whether Always show extension is selected.

segment.source: Shell New
segment.target: Shell New

segment.source: Displays Yes or No depending on whether the extension is added to the shell’s New menu.
segment.target: Displays Yes or No depending on whether the extension is added to the shell’s New menu.

segment.source: Applies To
segment.target: Applies To

segment.source: Displays User or Computer depending on whether this is a user-specific or computer-wide association.
segment.target: Displays User or Computer depending on whether this is a user-specific or computer-wide association.

segment.source: Icon File
segment.target: Icon File

segment.source: The original name of the icon file.
segment.target: The original name of the icon file.

segment.source: Icon Path
segment.target: Icon Path

segment.source: The original path or URL for the icon file.
segment.target: The original path or URL for the icon file.

segment.source: Cached Icon File
segment.target: Cached Icon File

segment.source: The name of the icon files in cache (which is a GUID in the current implementation).
segment.target: The name of the icon files in cache (which is a GUID in the current implementation).

segment.source: Cached Icon Path
segment.target: Cached Icon Path

segment.source: The full path to the icon files in cache.
segment.target: The full path to the icon files in cache.

segment.source: Content Type
segment.target: Content Type

segment.source: The content type.
segment.target: The content type.

segment.source: Perceived Type
segment.target: Perceived Type

segment.source: The perceived type or blank.
segment.target: The perceived type or blank.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.source: File Type Associations Node
segment.target: File Type Associations Node

segment.source: File Type Association Results Pane
segment.target: File Type Association Results Pane
